personalInfo.splInterest: Fitness, computers, yoga, movies, spending time with family

tourBios.intlVics: (3): 2013 PGA of British Columbia Championship [Can], PGA of British Columbia Assistants Championship [Can], Canada Cup [Can].
tourBios.carHigh:
Played PGA TOUR Canada from 2007-2011. 

2015: Best outing was a T70 at the ATB Financial Classic.

2014: Closed with a 9-under-par 62 to win the inaugural Forces and Families Open, overcoming a six-stroke deficit Sunday to become the first Canadian winner on Mackenzie Tour this season. Played final 11 holes in 9-under par, a run that included two eagles and a back-nine 30. After finding the green at the 72nd hole, rolled in a 70-foot birdie putt to post the clubhouse lead at 17-under, then watched as neither Jeff Dennis nor Peter Campbell could match him with a birdie at the last. When 54-hole leader Greg Eason failed to eagle to force a playoff, was crowned the champion, becoming the first Canadian to win since Max Gilbert at the 2013 TOUR Championship of Canada. Improved to ninth in the PGA TOUR Canada Order of Merit with the victory. 

2011: Best finish was a T37 at The Western Championship in June.

2010: Made five cut in five starts with season-besting finish a T39 at the Canadian Tour Championship.

2009: Four made cut in 10 events with a T22 at the Roxul Jane Rogers Championship his best finish.

2008: Best outing was a T21 at the Times Colonist Open in June.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was the 2004 Fresno Lexus Classic Champion...Helped Brigham Young University to a ninth-place finish at the 2004 NCAA Championship and a fourth-place showing at the 2005 NCAA Championship.
tourBios.personal: Has also worked as a server, landscaper and assistant pro at Summerland GC...Fan of the Vancouver Canucks...Favorite athletes are Jonathan Toews, LeBron James, Graham DeLaet and Daniel Summerhays...Dream foursome would include Johnny Miller, Jack Nicklaus and Daniel Summerhays...Never travels without his workout shoes...Marks his ball head's up with a toonie...Twitter is @gregmachtaler. Favorite course is Hazeltine National GC in Minnesota. Is a big fan of the Vancouver Canucks.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T was 1st in 2014 at the Forces and Families Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T78th in Total Eagles on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA TOUR Canada.
